text:
A married man knows the importance of following a righteous discourse.
 Married life is like a penance in which a couple gives birth and raises next generation.
 A married man is expected to get up early in the morning and contemplate on religious things.
 It helps him to follow righteous discourse.
 He is expected to attend nature’s call in natural environment away from his house.
 Soil is considered the best means to wash hands.
 It should be followed by cleansing of the body.
 He should then offer oblations wearing fresh clothes to sages, deities and his dead ancestors.
 Offering oblations to the Sun, worship of tutelary god and other deities follows then.
 If the household is having some cattle, the head of the family should himself milk them and then wait for the guest.
 If and when a guest arrives, the head of the family must offer him a seat respectfully and treat him well with delicious food and pleasant talk.
 In Indian tradition, a guest is regarded equal to a deity.
 He should take food only after feeding the guest.
 Evening time has also elaborate rituals for a married man.
 First of all, after finishing daily chores, a married man must worship with peaceful mind.
 It is also good for his health to take food early in the evening and retire to a wooden bedstead.
 Night time is considered suitable period for enjoying carnal pleasure.
 Here too, a married man should enjoy intimacy with his wife only.
title: Description of Righteousness
